meanings.definition: The granting of a fee or estate in land by a feudal lord to a vassal.
meanings.sent1: In medieval times, a feoffment was a way for a lord to give land to a vassal.
meanings.sent2: The feoffment of the estate was a formal ceremony in the feudal system.
meanings.sent3: The feoffment of the land was celebrated with a grand feast in the castle.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was like a feoffment, bestowing land upon those in need.
meanings.sent5: The feoffment of the property was engraved in the history books for its significance.

meanings.definition: To grant a fee or estate in land to someone.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to feoffment the land to his loyal knight.
meanings.sent2: She will feoffment the estate to her daughter upon her passing.
meanings.sent3: The farmer will feoffment the fertile land to his hardworking son.
meanings.sent4: His decision to feoffment the property surprised many in the village.
meanings.sent5: The act of feoffment symbolized trust and loyalty between the two parties.
